intro: Verticordia staminosa subsp. cylindracea, commonly known as the cylindrical featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, feathery inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, cylindrical flower spikes and vibrant red or orange flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats. This plant is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region, with flowering occurring during the warmer months.
